ry? =A0There are other things you can filter on. =A0And, there were

 definitely hackish parts of the implementation. =A0And, it turns

here were bugs in Categories, (such as

esign. =A0And, (sorry, maven

into the meat of the code.
>>
>> So, the first 4.9 snapshot is up today, wi=
th a new way of specifying
>> suites, called SuiteBuilder. =A0SuiteBuilder =
allows for flexible
>> specification of where to find the classes containin=
g tests, and how
>> to filter the resulting runners.
>>
>> This suite class=
 lists the explicit test classes to consider running,
>> and then filters i=
t down to only those tests or classes annotated with
>> `@Category(Yes.clas=
s)`:
>>
>> =A0 =A0 =A0 @RunWith(SuiteBuilder.class)
>> =A0 =A0 =A0 public s=
tatic class OnlyYes {
>> =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 @Classes
>> =A0 =A0 =
=A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 public Listed classes=3D new Listed(Yes1.class, Yes2.cl=
ass, No1.class);
>>
>> =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 @RunnerFilter
>> =A0 =A0=
 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 =A0 public CategoryFilter filter=3D CategoryFilter.include=
(Yes.class);
>> =A0 =A0 =A0 }
>>
>> We hope to soon include other implement=
ations for the @Classes
>> annotation, including a classpath-searching test=
 gatherer. =A0Other
>> implementations for @RunnerFilter also make sense (i=
f you look close,
>> you'll see that RunnerFilter implementations can also =
re-order
>> runners, as well as selecting them).
>>
>> Please have fun, and=
 let us know how it works for you. =A0Thanks,
>>
>> =A0 =A0David Saff
